prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
Mosaic in Band 3 in using standard setup.
Correlator setup: TDM mode. This provides a velocity resolution of ~100 km/s which is sufficient for this detection experiment.
Sensitivity: We aim at detecting molecular gas masses of ~4 10^9 Mo. We estimate that this results in a flux level of 0.65 mJy. Taking the average gravitational magnification into account, we can achieve this detection level at ~4sigma by reaching a 0.5 mJy channel-to-channel rms. The total estimated time is 2.4 hours including calibrations and overheads.
The mosaic is 100"x120" at a position angle of -30d. It consists of 26 pointings.

The mosaic is 100"x120" at a position angle of -30d. It consists of 26 pointings.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract:
We propose to do a deep CO line survey towards the cluster Abell 2744. This cluster is one of the HST Frontier Fields target and whose data has already been released. The gravitational lensing by the z=0.308 cluster provides a unique opportunity to probe the cold interstellar medium in very high redshift galaxies with a sensitivity that allows us to determine the gas fraction in L* galaxies. This information is crucial for understanding the initial buildup of galaxies at the epoch preceeding the peak of the cosmic star formation density.
In addition to the background galaxies, the mapping will include the CO(1-0) line for the cluster galaxies. This provides important information on the gas content and dynamics of this rich and massive cluster.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe

prp:CoInvestigator.prp:organisation: North American ALMA Science Center, National Radio Astronomy Observatory
Infrared Processing and Analysis Center (IPAC), California Institute of Technology
